snippet: Critics say focusing on mental illness as a component of gun violence unfairly singles out people more likely to be a victim of violence than a cause.
abstract: More state and national politicians, in their fervor to take action against gun violence after the shooting in Newtown, Conn, are promoting a focus on mental illness as a way to help prevent further killings; critics say focus unfairly singles out people more likely to be a victim of violence than a cause.

byline.original: By ERICA GOODE and JACK HEALY

lead_paragraph: Critics say focusing on mental illness as a component of gun violence unfairly singles out people more likely to be a victim of violence than a cause.

headline.main: Focus on Mental Health Laws to Curb Violence Is Unfair, Some Say
headline.print_headline: Focus on Mental Health Laws to Curb Violence Is Unfair, Some Say
